chefs.name: Sadia Rahman
chefs.bio: Sadia Rahman is a passionate chef who specializes in traditional Bengali cuisine. With over 10 years of experience in the culinary industry, she has perfected her craft and is known for her flavorful and aromatic dishes.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt. 
2. Fry the fish until golden brown. 
3. In a separate pan, heat oil and add mustard paste and green chilies. 
4. Add water and cook until the sauce thickens. 
5. Add the fried fish to the sauce and cook for a few more minutes. 
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chingri Malai Curry
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the prawns with turmeric and salt. 
2. Fry the prawns until golden brown. 
3. In a separate pan, heat oil and add cumin, ginger, and green chilies. 
4. Add water and cook until the sauce thickens. 
5. Add coconut milk to the sauce and cook for a few more minutes. 
6. Add the fried prawns to the sauce and cook for a few more minutes. 
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
recipes.method:
1. Boil the milk until it reduces to half. 
2. Add sugar and cardamom and stir well. 
3. Let it cool down to lukewarm temperature. 
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the yogurt until it becomes smooth. 
5. Add the milk mixture to the yogurt and mix well. 
6. Pour the mixture into small earthen pots. 
7. Keep it in a warm place for 6-7 hours or until set. 
8. Refrigerate before serving.

chefs.name: Ahmed Hossain
chefs.bio: Ahmed Hossain is a skilled chef who specializes in fusion Bengali cuisine. With a background in both traditional and modern cooking techniques, he has created a unique style that combines the best of both worlds.

recipes.name: Bhuna Khichuri
recipes.method:
1. Soak rice and lentils separately for at least 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onions. 
3. Add chopped garlic and ginger and sauté for a few minutes. 
4. Add the soaked rice and lentils and stir well. 
5. Add water and salt and cook until the rice and lentils are soft. 
6. Serve hot with a side of spicy pickles.

recipes.name: Kosha Mangsho
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the mutton with turmeric and salt. 
2. Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add sliced onions. 
3. Add chopped ginger and garlic and sauté for a few minutes. 
4. Add diced tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are soft. 
5. Add the marinated mutton and cook until the mutton is browned. 
6. Add water and pressure cook for 20-25 minutes. 
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Aloo Posto
recipes.method:
1. Peel and dice the potatoes. 
2. Soak the poppy seeds in water for 30 minutes. 
3. Drain the poppy seeds and grind them into a fine paste. 
4. Heat mustard oil in a pan and add green chillies. 
5. Add the diced potatoes and turmeric powder and fry for a few minutes. 
6. Add the poppy seed paste and salt and mix well. 
7. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes. 
8. Serve hot with rice.

chefs.name: Keka Hossain
chefs.bio: Keka Hossain is a skilled chef who specializes in fusion Bengali cuisine. With a background in both traditional and modern cooking techniques, he has created a unique style that combines the best of both worlds.

recipes.name: Chholar Dal
recipes.method:
1. Soak the chana dal in water for an hour. 
2. Boil the dal in a pressure cooker with water, bay leaves, and salt. 
3. Grind coconut, ginger, and cumin seeds into a fine paste. 
4. Heat oil in a pan and add the paste to it. 
5. Fry for a few minutes and add the boiled dal. 
6. Mix well and let it simmer for 5-7 minutes. 
7. Serve hot with rice or roti.

recipes.name: Shukto
recipes.method:
1. Slice the bitter gourd, drumsticks, potatoes, and ridge gourd into small pieces. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. 
3. Add the sliced vegetables and fry for a few minutes. 
4. Add water and salt and cover the pan. 
5. Let it cook for 10-15 minutes. 
6. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Baingan Bhaja
recipes.method:
1. Slice the eggplant into thin rounds. 
2. Sprinkle turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt on the slices. 
3. Heat oil in a pan and add the eggplant slices. 
4. Fry the slices on both sides until they turn golden brown. 
5. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

chefs.name: Rafsan Khandakar
chefs.bio: Rafsan Khandakar is a skilled chef who specializes in fusion Bengali cuisine. With a background in both traditional and modern cooking techniques, he has created a unique style that combines the best of both worlds.

recipes.name: Beef Biryani
recipes.method:
1. Wash the basmati rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add bay leaves, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon sticks, and cloves. 
3. Add sliced onions and fry until they turn golden brown. 
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a few minutes. 
5. Add diced tomatoes, biryani masala powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt. 
6. Mix well and add diced beef. 
7. Fry until the beef is browned on all sides. 
8. Add yogurt, green chillies, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. 
9. Mix well and add water. 
10. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat until the beef is tender. 
11. In a separate pan, boil water and add salt. 
12. Add the soaked basmati rice and cook until it's almost done. 
13. Drain the rice and spread it over the beef mixture in the pan. 
14. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes. 
15. Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Chicken Biryani
recipes.method:
1. Wash the basmati rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add bay leaves, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon sticks, and cloves. 
3. Add sliced onions and fry until they turn golden brown. 
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a few minutes. 
5. Add diced tomatoes, biryani masala powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt. 
6. Mix well and add diced chicken. 
7. Fry until the chicken is browned on all sides. 
8. Add yogurt, green chillies, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. 
9. Mix well and add water. 
10. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat until the chicken is tender. 
11. In a separate pan, boil water and add salt. 
12. Add the soaked basmati rice and cook until it's almost done. 
13. Drain the rice and spread it over the chicken mixture in the pan. 
14. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes. 
15. Serve hot with salad.

recipes.name: Mutton Biryani
recipes.method:
1. Wash the basmati rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add bay leaves, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon sticks, and cloves. 
3. Add sliced onions and fry until they turn golden brown. 
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a few minutes. 
5. Add diced tomatoes, biryani masala powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt. 
6. Mix well and add diced mutton. 
7. Fry until the mutton is browned on all sides. 
8. Add yogurt, green chillies, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. 
9. Mix well and add water. 
10. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat until the mutton is tender. 
11. In a separate pan, boil water and add salt. 
12. Add the soaked basmati rice and cook until it's almost done. 
13. Drain the rice and spread it over the mutton mixture in the pan. 
14. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes. 
15. Serve hot with salad.

chefs.name: Kabita Akter
chefs.bio: Kabita Akter is a skilled chef who specializes in fusion Bengali cuisine. With a background in both traditional and modern cooking techniques, he has created a unique style that combines the best of both worlds.

recipes.name: Rohu Fish Curry
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the fish pieces with turmeric and salt. 
2. Heat the mustard oil in a pan. 
3. Add chopped onions and minced garlic. Fry until golden brown. 
4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, and chopped tomato. Cook until the tomato is soft. 
5. Add water and bring to a boil. 
6. Add the marinated fish pieces and let it cook for 10-15 minutes until the fish is cooked and the gravy is thickened. 
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Kosha Mangsho
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the mutton with turmeric and salt. 
2. Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add sliced onions. 
3. Add chopped ginger and garlic and sauté for a few minutes. 
4. Add diced tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are soft. 
5. Add the marinated mutton and cook until the mutton is browned. 
6. Add water and pressure cook for 20-25 minutes. 
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Bengali Mustard Fish
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the fish pieces with turmeric and salt. 
2. Heat the mustard oil in a pan. 
3. Add chopped onions and minced garlic. Fry until golden brown. 
4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, and chopped tomato. Cook until the tomato is soft. 
5. Add water and bring to a boil. 
6. Add the marinated fish pieces and let it cook for 10-15 minutes until the fish is cooked and the gravy is thickened. 
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

chefs.name: Rifat Hossain
chefs.bio: Rifat Hossain is a skilled chef who specializes in fusion Bengali cuisine. With a background in both traditional and modern cooking techniques, he has created a unique style that combines the best of both worlds.

recipes.name: Ras Malai
recipes.method:
1. Boil the milk and add lemon juice to curdle the milk. 
2. Strain the curdled milk in a muslin cloth and wash it under cold water. 
3. Squeeze out the excess water and knead the cheese until smooth. 
4. Divide the cheese into small balls and flatten them slightly. 
5. Boil water and sugar in a pot and add cardamom and saffron. 
6. Add the cheese balls to the pot and cook for 10-12 minutes. 
7. Garnish with chopped pistachios and serve chilled.

recipes.name: Chomchom
recipes.method:
1. In a bowl, mix milk powder and all-purpose flour. 
2. Add water gradually and knead the mixture until it forms a dough. 
3. Divide the dough into small cylindrical shapes. 
4. Boil water and sugar in a pot and add cardamom and saffron. 
5. Add the dough shapes to the pot and cook for 10-12 minutes. 
6. Take out the shapes and let them cool. 
7. Garnish with chopped pistachios and serve chilled.

recipes.name: Sandesh
recipes.method:
1. Boil the milk and add lemon juice to curdle the milk. 
2. Strain the curdled milk in a muslin cloth and wash it under cold water. 
3. Squeeze out the excess water and knead the cheese until smooth. 
4. In a pan, heat sugar and a little water until it forms a syrup. 
5. Add the cheese to the pan and cook until the mixture thickens. 
6. Add cardamom and mix well. 
7. Pour the mixture into a greased dish and let it cool. 
8. Cut the sandesh into small pieces and garnish with chopped pistachios.
